group_1.textLeft: All that blend of smoke and clouds…@What terrible skies…
I can't even tell what time of day it is.
Danger looms here. You must escape@while you can, everyone.
I will not be joining you.@My fate is to die here on this soil.
And when you find my nephew Gaius@and explain how I died, tell him…

group_1.narration: "His scholarly curiosity and his mission@to rescue a friend were the two goals that@drove him to lead a small fleet of vessels@to investigate."
"Obstructed by the smoke,@he had no choice but to make a port of call@in Stabiae, where the smoke consumed him and@took his life…"

group_1.textLeft: *Chuckle* Is it bravery or stupidity?@I don't know how I will die,
but it seems to me it was my destiny@either way.

group_1.textRight: But all this— "He had not foreseen it…?!"
Why do you need to assemble such@a large fleet…?

group_1.textLeft: No need to be concerned.
Imperator Titus himself has approved@of our action.
Keep the fleet stationed in the nearby seas.
When a strange occurrence flares up@on Mount Vesuvius,
steer immediately to Pompeii to@rescue them.
Don't hesitate, and keep forging ahead…@Fortune favors the bold.
Oh yes, and one other thing…
Do not attribute any of this to my orders.@The credit is all yours.
…I do hope the adjutant doesn't disobey@my directive.
There's no need to go babbling about@Plinius's orders and the like.
*Chuckle…* Though I've certainly made it harder@for him to make sense of things later.

group_1.textRight: But why must we conceal the truth?

group_1.textLeft: I asked those girls who claimed to hail from@the future what my destiny would be.
Those girls are trying to reclaim a future,
one in which I die as a brave fool.
You must report to Gaius, in exact detail,@that this is how I died.
They told me that this story will be known@two thousand years from now.
In the unlikely event that Gaius leaves@a different record,
time will be eaten away by a paradox@and the world will be destroyed.
Therefore, I will die tomorrow,@and that will be good.
My fate should remain the same regardless@of what I know of the future…
You will once you're older.
[chara:834700:effect_shake]*Cough* *Cough*
*Chuckle* …This is difficult air for a man@with an ailing throat…
